required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anemia and Red Blood Cells Transfusion in Oncological Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Perioperative Anemia and Red Blood Cells Transfusion on Post-operative Complications After Oncological Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Oncologic patients experience anemia and anemia is associated with poor prognosis. Transfusion is associated with adverse events, and equipoise remains on the optimal transfusion strategy in oncologic patients in surgical setting. The primary objective of this study is to determine the impact of anemia and red blood cells (RBC) transfusion on post-operative complications and mortality.

detailed_description.textblock: Between 36 and 75% of oncologic patients experience anemia and anemia is associated with poor prognosis. Up to 40% of surgical oncologic patients receive red blood cells (RBC). However, transfusion is associated with adverse events, and equipoise remains on the optimal transfusion strategy in oncologic patients in surgical setting. The primary objective of this study is to determine the impact of anemia and red blood cells (RBC) transfusion on post-operative complications and mortality. This is a retrospective, single center study. All adults admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) after oncologic surgery within the study period are eligible.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of mortality or any respiratory, cardiac, renal, thromboembolic, infectious and/or hemorrhagic post operative complications
primary_outcome.description: mortality or any respiratory, cardiac, renal, thromboembolic, infectious and/or hemorrhagic post operative complications

study_pop.textblock: All adults admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) after oncologic surgery from January 2017 to December 2018 are eligible. The following types of surgery for cancer or metastasis resection with a high risk of bleeding are eligible: thoracic, abdominal, neurosurgery, gynecologic, urologic, otorhinolaryngology or spinal surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Surgery for cancer
- Admission to intensive care
Exclusion Criteria:
- no consent

facility.name: CHRU de Brest, hôpital de la Cavale Blanche
